Mario Draghi: The current stabilisation should not make us pause in our responses to these challenges
Mario Draghi: Important that observers recognise that these reforms at the national level will take time
Mario Draghi: Stronger governance cannot be effective without individual Member States also fulfilling their responsibilities
Mario Draghi: Prevention is better than cure – and that is the spirit of the compact
Mario Draghi: Citizens can be certain that we have all the necessary tools to achieve price stability
Mario Draghi: Eurosystem has tools to absorb excess liquidity, such as conduct of long-term liquidity absorbing operations
Mario Draghi: Risk measures very conservative. On the additional collateral presented so far, the average haircut is 53%
Mario Draghi: Banks using deposit facility are not identical to those borrowing from the Eurosystem
Mario Draghi: The money is now closer to small and medium-sized enterprises than it was before
Mario Draghi: LTRO's not to support sovereign debt markets or bolster bank profits but to prevent a credit crunch
Mario Draghi: The doomsday predictions were always exaggerated
Mario Draghi: Conditions in bank funding markets have improved, e.g. 70 billion euro in senior unsecured debt issued
Mario Draghi: Signs of stabilisation in both financial markets and overall economic activity – albeit still at low levels

Draghi: Monetary policy can ensure price stability, reduce risk premia and make sure that all transmission channels work.
Draghi: These misalignments have also become visible in deviations from price stability.
Draghi: Since introd. of the euro, unit labour costs have increased by 28% in deficit countries, 2.5 times as much as in surplus countries
Draghi: Current account imbalances within EA should be source of concern for policy-makers when they relate to losses of competitiveness
Draghi: Larger current account deficits of some countries have resulted from significant losses of national competitiveness
Draghi: Openness of EA has increased markedly. In the 90s, exports to the rest of the world were only 15% of GDP. Now they are 23% of GDP.
Draghi: Promoting comp. in Europe’s goods and serv. markets raises  potential for growth and job creation at little or no cost to publ.purse
Draghi: All the necessary tools to address potential upside risks to medium-term price stability are fully available http://t.co/GxqA2R1p
Draghi: As many as 800 banks participated in our last operation. The money is now closer to households and SME's than it was before.
Draghi: Banks account for over two thirds of external financing of firms in the euro area http://t.co/GxqA2R1p
Draghi: Countries should use this phase of financial stabilisation to make further progress on their programmes of economic reform.
Speech Mario Draghi: Competitiveness of the euro area and within the euro area http://t.co/GxqA2R1p
